Class Library

java.lang.Object
Library
public class Library extends Object
The Library Class stores all book/e-book related resources in an arraylist, simulating a library that holds resources such as physical books, electronic books and online journals.
Version:
1.6 (29/11/23)
Author:
Robert Mackie

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library()
      Constructor for objects of class Library

  • Method Details

    • printLibraryDetails

      public void printLibraryDetails()
      A method to print the details of each resource that is added to the library and the print method is able to differentiate between individual subclass instances (Book, Ebook, Journal)of resources in each list and prints the instance to the terminal.

    • checkLibrary

      public boolean checkLibrary(Resource resource)
      Check if Library currently contains a specific resource

    • changeAuthorFirstName

      public void changeAuthorFirstName(Resource resources, String newName)
      A method to edit an author objects first name. The method first checks if their is an Author Object associated with the resource before allowing any change.
      Parameters:
      Resource - resources The resource object the Author is attributed to
      String - newName The new first name for the Author to be changed to

    • searchForTitle

      public void searchForTitle(String searchString)
      Search through the library ArrayList for a specific resource title. When printing out the number of resources matching the search we also take into account the number of copies of the resource.
      Parameters:
      String - searchString The book title you are searching for

    • searchForAuthor

      public void searchForAuthor(String searchString)
      Search through the library ArrayList for a specific author by last name. The method will print out the information of the Author and the total number of resources they have associated with them. The search string also ignores case sensitive searches.
      Parameters:
      String - searchString The authors last name that you are searching for

    • removeResource

      public void removeResource(Resource resource)
      This method removes a specific resource from the library. The method checks if the resource is in the library and if it is available to be removed (i.e not currently being borrowed)
      Parameters:
      Resource - resource The resource object you want to remove

    • removeResource

      public void removeResource(int index)
      This method removes a resource from the library at a specified index. The method checks if the resource is in the library and if it is available to be removed (i.e not currently being borrowed)
      Parameters:
      int - index The resource you wish to remove from the library

    • getNumberOfResources

      public int getNumberOfResources()
      Return the number of total number of resources added to the Library
      Returns:
      int resources.size The total size of the resources list

    • getListOfResources

      public ArrayList getListOfResources()
      Return the ArrayList of Resources added to the Library

    • addResource

      public void addResource(Resource resource)
      Add an instance of a resource to the library. The conditional statment checks to see if the resource is already in the library before adding. If there is already a copy of the resource then the number of copies is updated to reflect this.
      Parameters:
      resource - The resource object to be added to the library.

    • borrowBook

      public void borrowBook(Resource resource, User LibraryMember)
      A method that allows a library member to borrow a book from the library. The method takes a Library Member and Resource input then adds the resource to the borrowed arraylist in the Library Class and the onloan ArrayList in the LIbrary Members class. The method first checks if the resource is an instance of a book, if the user is a Library Member, if there is a copy available, if the Library Membership is true, and if there is not already a library member borrowing it. If the User is a guest member then they are not allowed to borrow books as it is a member only privilege.
      Parameters:
      resource - Resource The resource to be added
      user - Library Member The resource object to be borrowed

    • returnBook

      public void returnBook(Resource resource, User LibraryMember, boolean damage, String updateDamage)
      A method that allows a library member to return a book from the library. The method takes a Library Member and Resource input then removes the resource from the borrowed arraylist in the Library Class and the onloan ArrayList in the LIbrary Members class. The method first checks if the resource is an instance of a book, if the user is a Library Member, if there is a copy available, if the Library Membership is true, and there isn't currently a libraryMember borrowing it.
      Parameters:
      Resource - resource The resource object to be returned.
      user - Library Member The the library member that is returning the resource.
      boolean - damage If there is damage then it should be true, else then false.
      String - updateDamage If there is damage then describe it, else use "".

    • addAuthor

      public void addAuthor(Author author)
      A method to add an Author object to the Library. The method checks to see if the Author already exists within the Library before attempting to add the object.
      Parameters:
      Author - The author object to be added to the library.

    • printAvailableResources

      public void printAvailableResources()
      A method to print the details of only available resources added to the library (i.e not borrowed) and the print method is able to differentiate between available individual resources in each list and prints the instances to the terminal.

    • printPhysicalResources

      public void printPhysicalResources()
      A method to print the details of only physical book objects added to the library and print out their details.

    • printElectronic

      public void printElectronic()
      A method to print the details of all electronic resources added to the library (E-Books and Journals) and print their details.
